name: Andrew Ye
short_description: Student at Stanford University pursuing a B.S. in Mathematics and Computer Science. Previously studied at Case Western Reserve University and has research experience in machine learning with publications at NeurIPS 2023 and ICML 2024.
long_description:
Andrew Ye is a student at Stanford University pursuing a B.S. in Mathematics and Computer Science (2024-2026). He previously studied at Case Western Reserve University (2022-2024) before transferring to Stanford in fall 2024.

Andrew has significant research experience, working as an Undergraduate Researcher at the Case School of Engineering at Case Western Reserve University since June 2023. His research with Dr. Shuai Xu, Dr. Vipin Chaudhary, and the Rice DATA lab has led to publications at prestigious conferences including NeurIPS 2023 and ICML 2024.

His professional experience includes working as a Visiting Instructor at DigiPen Institute of Technology (June-July 2024), where he taught Data Analytics and Statistics. He also served as a Teaching Assistant at Case Western Reserve University (August 2023-May 2024) for Algorithms and Discrete Mathematics courses.

Andrew gained industry experience as a Software Engineering Intern at Zventus (May-August 2023), focusing on healthcare technologies. Additionally, he has volunteering experience with North Helpline (May 2021-April 2022).

His academic background, research publications, and teaching experience demonstrate his expertise in mathematics, computer science, and data analytics, with a particular focus on machine learning research.
